about.name: The following questions are from real DMV written tests. These are some of the actual permit questions you will face in California. Each permit practice test question has three answer choices. Select one answer for each question and select "grade this section." You can find this button at the bottom of the drivers license quiz.  For a complete list of questions and answers for California please visit https://cheat-sheets.dmv-written-test.com/en/california/car.

hasPart.name: Flash your brake lights or turn on your emergency flashers if you:

about.name: Flash your brake lights or turn on your emergency flashers if you:

hasPart.assesses: Flash your brake lights or turn on your emergency flashers if you: | Flash your brake lights or turn on your emergency flashers if you: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: If you can see a collision ahead, warn the drivers behind you by turning on your emergency flashers or by tapping your brake pedal quickly three or four times.

suggestedAnswer.text: Need to warn other drivers of a collision ahead.

comment.text: Need to warn other drivers of a collision ahead.

suggestedAnswer.text: Are temporarily parked in a traffic lane to make delivery.

comment.text: Are temporarily parked in a traffic lane to make delivery.

suggestedAnswer.text: Are backing out of a parking space.

comment.text: Are backing out of a parking space.

acceptedAnswer.text: Need to warn other drivers of a collision ahead.

comment.text: Need to warn other drivers of a collision ahead.

answerExplanation.text: If you can see a collision ahead, warn the drivers behind you by turning on your emergency flashers or by tapping your brake pedal quickly three or four times.

hasPart.name: This bicyclist is signaling:
hasPart.assesses: This bicyclist is signaling: | This bicyclist is signaling: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Bicycles do not have turn signals so bicyclists use hand and arm signals to alert other drivers to their intentions. If a bicyclist puts their left arm straight out, they are signaling that they intend to turn left.

comment.text: A left turn.
An upcoming stop.
A right turn.
A left turn.

answerExplanation.text: Bicycles do not have turn signals so bicyclists use hand and arm signals to alert other drivers to their intentions. If a bicyclist puts their left arm straight out, they are signaling that they intend to turn left.

comment.text: This bicyclist is signaling: | Bicycles do not have turn signals so bicyclists use hand and arm signals to alert other drivers to their intentions. If a bicyclist puts their left arm straight out, they are signaling that they intend to turn left.

hasPart.name: You want to pass a bicyclist in a narrow traffic lane when an oncoming vehicle is approaching. You should:

about.name: You want to pass a bicyclist in a narrow traffic lane when an oncoming vehicle is approaching. You should:

hasPart.assesses: You want to pass a bicyclist in a narrow traffic lane when an oncoming vehicle is approaching. You should: | You want to pass a bicyclist in a narrow traffic lane when an oncoming vehicle is approaching. You should: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: In this situation, you should take on one danger at a time. Rather than trying to squeeze between the bicyclist and the other vehicle, you should slow down to let the other vehicle pass, and then pass the bicyclist when it is safe to do so.

suggestedAnswer.text: Honk your horn then pass the bicyclist.

comment.text: Honk your horn then pass the bicyclist.

suggestedAnswer.text: Slow down and let the vehicle pass you before you pass the bicyclist.

comment.text: Slow down and let the vehicle pass you before you pass the bicyclist.

suggestedAnswer.text: Wait until the bicyclist rides off the roadway.

comment.text: Wait until the bicyclist rides off the roadway.

acceptedAnswer.text: Slow down and let the vehicle pass you before you pass the bicyclist.

comment.text: Slow down and let the vehicle pass you before you pass the bicyclist.

answerExplanation.text: In this situation, you should take on one danger at a time. Rather than trying to squeeze between the bicyclist and the other vehicle, you should slow down to let the other vehicle pass, and then pass the bicyclist when it is safe to do so.

comment.text: You want to pass a bicyclist in a narrow traffic lane when an oncoming vehicle is approaching. You should: | In this situation, you should take on one danger at a time. Rather than trying to squeeze between the bicyclist and the other vehicle, you should slow down to let the other vehicle pass, and then pass the bicyclist when it is safe to do so.

hasPart.name: Which of these vehicles must always stop before crossing railroad tracks?

about.name: Which of these vehicles must always stop before crossing railroad tracks?

hasPart.assesses: Which of these vehicles must always stop before crossing railroad tracks? | Which of these vehicles must always stop before crossing railroad tracks? -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Trucks transporting hazardous loads must stop before they cross railroad tracks.

suggestedAnswer.text: Tank trucks marked with hazardous materials placards.

comment.text: Tank trucks marked with hazardous materials placards.

suggestedAnswer.text: Motor homes or pickup trucks towing a boat trailer.

comment.text: Motor homes or pickup trucks towing a boat trailer.

suggestedAnswer.text: Any vehicle with three or more axles and weighing more than 4,000 pounds.

comment.text: Any vehicle with three or more axles and weighing more than 4,000 pounds.

acceptedAnswer.text: Tank trucks marked with hazardous materials placards.

comment.text: Tank trucks marked with hazardous materials placards.

answerExplanation.text: Trucks transporting hazardous loads must stop before they cross railroad tracks.

comment.text: Which of these vehicles must always stop before crossing railroad tracks? | Trucks transporting hazardous loads must stop before they cross railroad tracks.

hasPart.name: When you see this sign, you should stop and:

about.name: When you see this sign, you should stop and:

hasPart.assesses: When you see this sign, you should stop and: | When you see this sign, you should stop and: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: At a stop sign, you must come to a full stop and check for traffic in all directions before proceeding.

suggestedAnswer.text: Check for vehicles only in the direction that you plan on going, then proceed.

comment.text: Check for vehicles only in the direction that you plan on going, then proceed.

suggestedAnswer.text: Let all vehicles that arrive before or after you go first.

comment.text: Let all vehicles that arrive before or after you go first.

suggestedAnswer.text: Check for traffic in all directions before proceeding.

comment.text: Check for traffic in all directions before proceeding.

acceptedAnswer.text: Check for traffic in all directions before proceeding.

comment.text: Check for traffic in all directions before proceeding.

answerExplanation.text: At a stop sign, you must come to a full stop and check for traffic in all directions before proceeding.

comment.text: When you see this sign, you should stop and: | At a stop sign, you must come to a full stop and check for traffic in all directions before proceeding.

hasPart.name: Hydroplaning occurs when tires ride on a thin film of water instead of on the surface of the road. To prevent hydroplaning in rainy weather, you should:

about.name: Hydroplaning occurs when tires ride on a thin film of water instead of on the surface of the road. To prevent hydroplaning in rainy weather, you should:

hasPart.assesses: Hydroplaning occurs when tires ride on a thin film of water instead of on the surface of the road. To prevent hydroplaning in rainy weather, you should: | Hydroplaning occurs when tires ride on a thin film of water instead of on the surface of the road. To prevent hydroplaning in rainy weather, you should: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: In rainy weather, you should lower your speed to reduce the risk of hydroplaning. Driving too fast may cause your tires to ride up on the water and lose contact with the surface of the road, making it very difficult to control your vehicle.

suggestedAnswer.text: Put on your cruise control to maintain a constant speed.

comment.text: Put on your cruise control to maintain a constant speed.
Decrease your speed.

suggestedAnswer.text: Move to the shoulder of the road as soon as it starts to rain.

comment.text: Move to the shoulder of the road as soon as it starts to rain.
Decrease your speed.

answerExplanation.text: In rainy weather, you should lower your speed to reduce the risk of hydroplaning. Driving too fast may cause your tires to ride up on the water and lose contact with the surface of the road, making it very difficult to control your vehicle.

comment.text: Hydroplaning occurs when tires ride on a thin film of water instead of on the surface of the road. To prevent hydroplaning in rainy weather, you should: | In rainy weather, you should lower your speed to reduce the risk of hydroplaning. Driving too fast may cause your tires to ride up on the water and lose contact with the surface of the road, making it very difficult to control your vehicle.
